question: The Indian Navy’s first indigenously built Floating Dock (FDN-2) has been launched at which of the following shipyards?
explanation: The Kattupalli Shipyard cum Captive Port Complex is a large shipyard project at Kattupalli village in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. It is being built by L&T Shipbuilding Ltd. The shipyard was recently in the news when the Indian Navy’s first indigenously built Floating Dock (FDN-2) was launched at this Shipyard. The Floating Dock is 185 metres long and 40 metres wide and will enable docking of all kinds of vessels, including naval ships and submarines of up to 8,000 tonnes displacement, with draughts of up to seven metres.
